text:
(1) Peddlers--Ice and Coal: On the lower East Side, in Manhattan, they call for their ice with baby carriages. This is near Manhattan Bridge.

P. L. Sperr

(2) and (3) An ice man's shanty, corner of Hoyt Avenue and 27th Street, Astoria, Queens.

P. L. Sperr
May 27, 1934
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Ice and Coal - [Queens].

text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, west from 27th Street. The Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge was later constructed here and numerous buildings demolished. View 2 is west from Crescent Street and view 3 shows some of the homes seen in view 1 being prepared for razing.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: March, 1931
View 2: May 27, 1934

Hoyt Avenue, north side, west from 27th Street. The Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge was later constructed here and numerous buildings demolished. View 2 is west from Crescent Street and view 3 shows some of the homes seen in view 1 being prepared for razing.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: March, 1931
View 2: May 27, 1934

Hoyt Avenue, north side, west from 27th Street. The Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge was later constructed here and numerous buildings demolished. View 2 is west from Crescent Street and view 3 shows some of the homes seen in view 1 being prepared for razing.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: March, 1931
View 2: May 27, 1934

27th Street, north from Hoyt Avenue, showing apartment houses being torn down for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. The buildings are on the east side of the street.
View 2 is south toward Hoyt (25th) Avenue from the middle of the block.
View 3 shows a detail of demolition operations.

P. L. Sperr     August 1934
Views 1, 2, 3:

27th Street, north from Hoyt Avenue, showing apartment houses being torn down for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. The buildings are on the east side of the street.
View 2 is south toward Hoyt (25th) Avenue from the middle of the block.
View 3 shows a detail of demolition operations.

P. L. Sperr     August 1934
Views 1, 2, 3:

27th Street, north from Hoyt Avenue, showing apartment houses being torn down for the construction of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. The buildings are on the east side of the street.
View 2 is south toward Hoyt (25th) Avenue from the middle of the block.
View 3 shows a detail of demolition operations.

P. L. Sperr     August 1934
Views 1, 2, 3:

Hoyt Avenue, north side, between 24th and Crescent Streets, showint the back yards of homes fronting on 24th (left) and Crescent Streets. Some of these will be torn down to make way for the construction of the Triborough Bridge.

P. L. Sperr
May 27, 1934

Hoyt Avenue, north side, at 27th and 28th Streets, showing the demolition of buildings for the construction of the Queens approach of the Triborough Bridge. In the background is the Hellgate Bridge. View 3 shows the Crystal Gardens Apartments.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: August 3, 1934
View 3: September 20, 1934

Hoyt Avenue, north side, at 27th and 28th Streets, showing the demolition of buildings for the construction of the Queens approach of the Triborough Bridge. In the background is the Hellgate Bridge. View 3 shows the Crystal Gardens Apartments.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: August 3, 1934
View 3: September 20, 1934

Hoyt Avenue, north side, at 27th and 28th Streets, showing the demolition of buildings for the construction of the Queens approach of the Triborough Bridge. In the background is the Hellgate Bridge. View 3 shows the Crystal Gardens Apartments.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: August 3, 1934
View 3: September 20, 1934

Triborough Bridge: Three views showing the bridge under construction, viewing northwestward on Hoyt Avenue from 27th Street (view 1) and 31st Street (views 2,3), Queens. Many buildings were razed to create the clearance marking the course of the bridge. In the background is the Hell Gate Bridge.

Views 1,2: June 12, 1935
View 3: November 9, 1935

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - [Queens].
